description: From Middle English untrust, untrost, untrist, probably a modified form of Old Norse útraust (“untrust”), equivalent to un- +‎ trust. Cognate with Icelandic útraust (“untrust”). Compare also Swedish otro (“lack of faith, disbelief”).

entries.meaning: Lack or absence of trust; mistrust; distrust.
examples: Alternatively, untrust corresponds to the space between distrust and trust, in which an agent is positively trusted, but not sufficiently to cooperate with.

description: From Middle English untrust, untriste, probably from Old Norse útraustr (“untrustworthy”). Cognate with Icelandic útraustur.

adjectives.description: untrust (comparative more untrust, superlative most untrust)
